responses.content:
```yaml leads: - headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 Form Builder Preview analysis: | The TYPO3 Form Builder's PreviewPage.html template appears to directly output form values without proper sanitization. Specifically, the `formValue.processedValue` variable is used within a table cell (``) and a list item (`
  • `) without being escaped for HTML. This could allow an attacker to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the preview page by submitting malicious input through a form. If an attacker can control the data displayed in the preview, they can potentially execute JavaScript in the context of the user's browser, leading to session hijacking, data theft, or other malicious actions. cwe: CWE-79 function_names: [] filenames: - Resources/Private/Form/PreviewPage.html classification: slightly promising - headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 Form Builder Static Text Element analysis: | The `Resources/Private/Form/StaticText.html` template in the TYPO3 Form Builder application uses the `f:format.nl2br()` view helper to format text for display. This view helper converts newline characters to `
    ` tags, which could potentially introduce Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities if the text being formatted is not properly sanitized. cwe: CWE-79 function_names: [] filenames: - Resources/Private/Form/StaticText.html classification: slightly promising ```

leads.headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 Form Builder Preview
leads.analysis:
The TYPO3 Form Builder's PreviewPage.html template appears to directly output form values without proper sanitization. Specifically, the formValue.processedValue variable is used within a table cell (<td>) and a list item (<li>) without being escaped for HTML. This could allow an attacker to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the preview page by submitting malicious input through a form.

If an attacker can control the data displayed in the preview, they can potentially execute JavaScript in the context of the user's browser, leading to session hijacking, data theft, or other malicious actions.

leads.headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in TYPO3 Form Builder Static Text Element
leads.analysis:
The Resources/Private/Form/StaticText.html template in the TYPO3 Form Builder application uses the f:format.nl2br() view helper to format text for display. This view helper converts newline characters to
tags, which could potentially introduce Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities if the text being formatted is not properly sanitized.
